case_vignette: A 58-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-month history of diffuse muscle pain, malaise, pain in both knees, recurrent episodes of abdominal and chest pain. He has also had a 5-kg (11-lb) weight loss over the past 4 months. Four years ago, he was diagnosed with chronic hepatitis B infection and was started on tenofovir. There are several ulcerations around the ankle and calves bilaterally. Perinuclear anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies are negative. Urinalysis shows proteinuria and hematuria. Muscle biopsy shows a transmural inflammation of the arterial wall with leukocytic infiltration and fibrinoid necrosis.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been suffering from muscle pain all over, feeling generally unwell, pain in both of my knees, and I keep having episodes of stomach and chest pain.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
For about 3 months now.
Do you have any medical conditions or are you taking any medications currently?
Yes, I was diagnosed with chronic hepatitis B four years ago and I've been taking tenofovir for it.
Do you have a family history of any autoimmune diseases or rheumatologic conditions?
I'm sorry, I don't have that information. My knowledge is limited to the case vignette you provided.
I understand. Thank you for the information. Have you noticed any swelling or stiffness in your joints along with the pain?
I haven't mentioned any issues with swelling or stiffness, just the pain in my knees.
Understood. Are you experiencing any dryness in your mouth or eyes?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any dryness in my mouth or eyes.
I see. Have you noticed any rashes on your skin?
No rashes, but I have several ulcerations around my ankles and calves on both sides.
**Final Diagnosis:** Rheumatoid Arthritis with Vasculitis and Hepatitis B co-infection
